Subject: Learn to Build Your Own Cosplay Armor
Description: Iron Man, Halo, Mass Effect, Star Wars -- what do all of these have in common? Some of the most impressive looking costumes you will see out there involve armor.  In this panel we will discuss multiple forms and techniques of armor construction for cosplay.  You might be surprised at how simple it can be to create very impressive looking armor from some easy to find materials.  Speakers include:Alex Drummer, Kevin McLeod, Justin Coluzzi - Track: Costuming  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: Projector

Subject: Straight-Razor Shaving: A Semi-Bloody Tutorial
Description: Want the closest shave you can get without self-Sweeney Todding yourself?  Straight-razor shaves are intimidating - so let us show you how it all works in a live demonstration, removing our stubble for your edification!  Speakers include:Ferrett Steinmetz, Alex Drummer - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Elements of Costuming for Dr. Who
Description: Trace the history of the Doctor through costuming elements of each one's style, and learn how to mix and match fashions to create your own Dr. Who look.  Speakers include:Justin Coluzzi, Kevin McLeod, Alex Drummer - Track: Costuming  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: Projector

Subject: Modding Nerf for Cosplay
Description: Nerf guns and blasters are an amazing source for cosplay weaponry.  The bright yellow and blue colors they come in, however, might distract from your costume.  In this panel we will discuss and demonstrate how to disassemble a Nerf gun so you can prep it for painting.  We will even show you how to put it back together so it still works.  Speakers include:Alex Drummer, Kevin McLeod, Justin Coluzzi - Track: Costuming  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: Projector
